channel.title: Sara Conklin's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Sara Conklin's Blog

item.title: Histograms
item.description: Step 1: Bring in Packages In order to start the process, we must first obtain the Lahman, sqldf, and ggplot2 packages. Once obtained, we must bring the packages through ‘library’. We do this as follows: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) Step 2: Extract the Data We can now begin assembling our Histogram. For this to work, we have to first extract the desired data.

item.title: Scatterplots
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) ## Loading required package: gsubfn ## Loading required package: proto ## Loading required package: RSQLite library(ggplot2) Step 1: Extract the Data In order to begin, we must fist bring into our Rmarkdown page the packages Lahman, sqldf, and ggplot2. We bring these in by using ‘library’ as shown above. We are then ready to extract our chosen data. We must do this and store the data in ‘result’ in order to link our scatterplot to the data we extracted.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
